pr_title: Add explicit generation member to data streams

timeline.message: add generation member, derive current write index from generation, DRY backing index naming logic

timeline.bodyText: maybe statically import getBackingIndexName(...) for readability?
timeline.author: martijnvg

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if we should simply keep this (and the IndexAbstraction.DataStream constructor) as it was, except to add an assertion that the generation we have should match the name of the last index in the list. I think we want that to hold true anyway?
timeline.author: henningandersen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1384,7 +1384,7 @@ public Metadata build() {
 
                     IndexMetadata writeIndex = backingIndices.get(backingIndices.size() - 1);

replies.bodyText:
I agree that the backing index list should have a defined order and that we can simplify the validation that the generation matches the last name in the list.
If you're also suggesting that we keep the separate writeIndex parameter on the IndexAbstraction.DataStream constructor, I don't see why that would continue to be necessary since the value for the writeIndex parameter would always be backingIndices.get(backingIndices.size() - 1)?
replies.author: danhermann

replies.bodyText: Ah yes, you are right, we do not need to keep that.
replies.author: henningandersen
